$President Vernicka$
I think I can guess why the Anti-Goddess Faction sent me someone at this moment.
But wait a while until I finish reading this letter.

$President Vernicka$
……Oh well, this is an absurd story beyond my expectations. Well, I guess Lagendia would suffer the most when the army from Mistland invades their lands so maybe it's natural that they sent someone...

$President Vernicka$
(Vernicka is lost in his thoughts.)

*You can continue after reaching Lv82.

$President Vernicka$
Lagendians are considered almost like phantoms here… You must be a special one to be standing in front of me.

${user_nick}$
Phantoms?

$President Vernicka$
I don't know what Lagendians think about themselves but to us Mistlanders, Lagendia is a world of illusion created by an endless dream of Goddess Altea. So the people living there must be illusions too.

${user_nick}$
(So the people in Mistland already knew that the world in Lagendia is a dream… They seem to have a different perspective from us...)

$President Vernicka${sound:npc_Vernicka_9705_qu_01.ogg}
Anyways, you're in the neutral free state Merca. This is a man-made utopia in the wastelands created by the merchants. Phantoms, Childs, Anti-Goddesses, what have you, any guests are welcome here.

${user_nick}$
Does that mean you'll take the side of any guest too?

$President Vernicka$
Do you know that neutrality only exists when the power of either sides are somewhat equal? Let's say one side is empty-handed but the other side has a giant fortified sword and they're entering a battle. If I don't do anything in this situation saying that I'm neutral, doesn't it mean that I'm siding with the strong?

$President Vernicka$
So we don't take anyone's side in times of conflict or war. We merely provide weapon for the empty-handed.

${user_nick}$
…I came to help the Anti-Goddess Faction, and they are currently much weaker than the Army of Destruction… So are you going to provide me with weapon too?

$President Vernicka$
There's a point you seem to be missing. I'm a tradesman. If you need a sword, you should pay money and buy it. If you don't have money, you should at least pay with something else. Don't you agree?

${user_nick}$
That doesn't make sense. Most of the weak ones are those who don't have much money. Does that mean merchants are at the end of the day people who side with the strong?

$President Vernicka$
That's a stupid comment. Do you think strength and weakness only comes from material things? I know you might scoff hearing this coming from a merchant, but there are things of intangible value in this world and that's what's traded at the highest price. If I give the sword to someone who doesn't even know how to swing it properly, that wouldn't make any economic sense, would it?

$President Vernicka$
I know you've been sent by the Anti-Goddess Faction and that you're a special person from Lagendia, but does that represent your worth? I've not even made up my mind on whether to help the Anti-Goddess Faction yet. Are you naively thinking that I'm going to help you for certain because I'm neutral and I help the weak?

$President Vernicka$
I've climbed to my current position all alone after becoming an orphan. I had nothing but I at least had the grit to stay alive and that got myself the favour of the former president. So you should show me your worth too. Convince me that I can trust you and help the Anti-Goddess Faction.

${user_nick}$
What would be enough to make you trust me?

$President Vernicka$
Come to think of it, I have just the right task for you. It has been quite some time since a band of thieves occupied the Goldstone Mine located in the outskirts of Merca's Heart and amassed wealth by brewing Goldstone's Tears. We've had a hard time trying to get rid of them and now we're almost coexisting with those thieves... Still, their forces would grow too strong if we don't keep them in check once in a while.

$President Vernicka$
Most of the Goldstone are used to craft liquor that causes hallucination, but Goldstone Elixir is a highly valuable gemstone. If you clear the Broken Goldstone Thieves and bring me the Goldstone Elixir, you'll be able to prove your strength and also prove that you're someone I can trust.

${user_nick}$
All right. If that's what will make you trust me and the Anti-Goddess Faction...

$Injured Thief$
(There's someone who looks like a thief. He looks injured.)

$President Vernicka$
Don't look down on the Broken Goldstone Thieves. They have been the ruler of the Broken Goldstone Canyon for a long time, and the mastermind behind them is… Nevermind, you don't need to know the details. Anyway, they are not easy opponents so prepare yourself before you go.

$Injured Thief$
An outsider! Are you one of Tryan's soldiers? Under whose orders did you come here?

${user_nick}$
(Tryan's soldier?)
How about you? You look like one of the thieves. Why do you want to know who I am?

$Injured Thief$
(He seems to be taking caution not to be noticed by others.) I can't do anything now even if you attack me… But can you do me a favour and just walk away like you never saw me? As you can see, I'm injured and I don't have the strength to hurt you.

${user_nick}$
……I don't want to hurt anyone without a reason too. But you're a thief and I'm on President Vernicka's mission to get rid of the thieves! (Draw weapon)

$Injured Thief$
…So you're here on Vernicka's orders. Belive it or not, I'm someone who has connections with him. If you kill me, I would fail in fulfilling a mission from Vernicka too.

${user_nick}$
(He looks so determined… Can I really trust him? Well, he's gravely hurt and attacking him now would be playing dirty. If he's really a thief, then my attack can be justified but if he isn't, I would regret it deeply. Life is precious so maybe I should trust him this time.)

${user_nick}$
Trust starts from believing… Even if you don't know Vernicka, I hope you will change your ways and become a good man if you know what gratitude is.
(Lower your weapon and wrap his wounds with spare cloth. Apply some ointment for him too.)

$Injured Thief$
……Thanks. Although I can't tell you the details, I will repay your kind trust in me. I don't want to make Vernicka worry unnecessarily, so I hope you won't tell him about meeting me too.

$Injured Thief$
(He's taking a rest with his eyes closed. It would be better to go now.)

$President Vernicka$
You're back. You really are something. You've brought the Goldstone Elixir from the Broken Goldstone Thieves. You must have been blessed by Lagendia's dragons indeed like what Norfe said.

$President Vernicka$
Red Dragon Rubinart is single-handedly blocking the entire Army of Destruction with the force field made with only half of his jewel… Even a single dragon can be so strong. I heard you have the other half of Rubinart's jewel and have the protection of another dragon too. That would make you a trustworthy ally. Hahaha….

${user_nick}$
…Did the letter from the Anti-Goddess Faction have such details about me and Rubinart?

$President Vernicka$
Ah… It seems like you need some explanations.
(Vernicka narrows his eyes and smiles)

$President Vernicka$
I couldn't reveal everything from the beginning but I'll be honest with you since I've decided to help you and the Anti-Goddess Faction.

$President Vernicka$
This place used to be a barren land with nothing. It even had the Monolith's door located here which brought endless strifes for control. Such a place managed to evolve into a thriving city called Merca by making use of the conflicts to supply war materials and staying neutral. But what was more crucial was that Merca managed to secure and sell important information.

$President Vernicka$
What's more valuable than money? What's traded at the highest price? It's information. Information flows into markets where people from various places gather and chat. On top of that, the merchants travel across the entire continent and meet all kinds of people. We can say that every single one of Merca's merchants are secret agents.

$President Vernicka$
That's why we know much more than what you can imagine, and maybe more than the Anti-Goddess Faction too. We can stretch our hands to places where the Anti-Goddess Faction can't reach.
Well, I'm just saying this for your own reference.

${user_nick}$
(He surely is called the Blue Viper of Merca for a reason…)

$President Vernicka$
Anyway, Merca hopes that the Anti-Goddess Faction can become strong enough to face the Army of Destruction. We wouldn't want the Childs to invade Lagendia and become stronger than they are now.

${user_nick}$
Come to think of it, why are you keeping a neutral ground? Since Goddess Vestinel's influence is so strong here, why don't you just succumb and join her side?

$President Vernicka${sound:npc_Vernicka_9705_qu_02.ogg}
To Goddess Vestinel, everyone except for the Childs and the Army of Destruction are nothing but tools. I'm not a Child and I'm not strong enough to join the Army of Destruction either.

$President Vernicka$
That means I need to become someone they need. Someone whom they need but can't order around as they please. I supply what they need, but I don't take anyone's side so that makes me more valuable. The more factions there are that oppose each other, the higher my value.

$President Vernicka$
Anyways, a truce is good for the Anti-Goddess Faction and for us too. Since I have a trustworthy assistant with me now, there's no reason why I shouldn't carry on with the plans.
<html>$Quest Reward$</html>

$President Vernicka$
I believe you have someone to contact with to communicate with the Anti-Goddess Faction. Go to that person and convey the message that I'll help the Anti-Goddess Faction to call a truce and that their generous support in any way would be extremely welcome.

journal.contents:
Hiver, an agent from the Anti-Goddess Faction, asked you to meet Vernicka, the head of Merca city-state and work on calling a truce. Go to the Merca City Headquarters and meet Vernicka.

Merca's Heart (Merca City Headquarters) - President Vernicka
